author: Michael Madden
comment: I like the layout of the app. It looks great and transitions smoothly, but it's impossible to see the full headline (when you use a large font), making it hard to recommend to people who use large fonts.

author: Joshua Miller
comment: Great app that makes it so much easier to read my Feedly list! I can only imagine this getting even better with Luke Klinker behind the wheel.

author: Michael P. Jackson
comment: Not terribly active development, at this time, but from an exceptional developer, and has definite 5 ⭐ potential, but not quite there yet. I'm sure if it gets back to 'the front burner' it will quickly evolve into an app with no competition even in its league.

author: Stephen Regan
comment: Update: Take a page from the app called "The Digg" as u can sign Into your FB and Google accts, etc accounts for personal news... Also, Can now share right to FaceSlim, awesome!  I only have one more wish, keep up the cool swipe away Blackberry like gestures and take a few notes out of flipboards page as in an example if/I can Type "turtle" for searching news and it shows up but if I type more specific types of turtles like "Fly River Turtle" as in more specific unlike Flipboard it will not show yet I know it is out there and this has the better interface, gestures, etc this is going to be HUGE, keep it up!! Another excellent app for news by an excellent dev of my fave app Evolve SMS. I just wish one thing, please allow us to search ANYTHING at all as flipboard used to do. As in any single word search everywhere for new articles matching any word for instance "turtles" or even a specific breed of turtle as in not just what's pre picked for me as in most popular topics but an extremely personalized news "source" which will search YouTube and Google, Quora, etc for any words put into favorites.. Then this app will be my one and only news app! Thanks dev... Please update this and sms messages. Talon is becoming for user friendly as well... Source is on its way!..... Love the way it doesn't stay in recent app list when opening widget. I suggest giving this app away free for a few days or weeks or some advertising as its only issue ATM is people do most know about it. Maybe give people a notice in evolve somehow without pissing them off, hmm... the folks who didn't pay for evolve maybe?...

author: J R Beckstead
comment: If you are looking for news app that integrates Twitter and other sources.. This is it. Wonderfully done.

author: Josh Wood
comment: Revisiting this app: Still can't import OPML...

author: Joshua O'Hara
comment: Still not there yet.

author: Vlada Stojanovic
comment: Could be the best app but its buggy a lot. It repeats articles for example. On the other hand it looks like Luke abandoned this app. Too bad.

No way to change back to unread for an article, no way to open a specific feed, no way to stay in article view and jump to the next article... All features that are must have for heavy rss users. Pathetic
The design of the app is amazing! the UI is beautiful.

author: David Lee
comment: Normally I don't buy news reading apps because there are so many free ones in the store. But since this dev makes good apps such as talon and slide messages, I though I give this app a try. Sure, there are some flaws that need to be fixed. But so far so good, as long the updates keep on coming. One issue that keeps coming up is that I'm constantly getting the message telling me that the app has crashed, if I'm using the widget.
title: Getting there

author: J Mo
comment: The app looks great and manages to show more of the feed than other apps that just show a short summary. I was looking for a syncing replacement for Feedly because my work has blocked it. Source pulls all my feeds in from The Old Reader well but it's not syncing read articles back to TOR. Maybe it's not supposed to but I can't see the point of using an API to a third party if it doesn't. If sync is fixed or added, this would be my daily driver.
title: Looks Great - Was Hoping For Sync

author: Ryan Frankenstein
comment: Luv the look and feel, but can't stand the constant repeated articles.  Same ones over and over.  And if you leave and come back by any means it jumps you back to the top losing your spot.  Some of the news sources are political trash.
title: Close

author: Anthony Huerta
comment: It has everything I could want in an app that has my news.
title: Best app for all my news

author: El DeTh
comment: Talon is my twitter client of choice so I thought source would be amazing too. Well it doesn't load the news reliable (inoreader) and it marks every article as read. The "complete article text" feature is nice but all the pictures or graphics  embeded in the article are missing.

author: Hallman Home
comment: Light weight and good UI. The widget only opens the articles. It needs to be able to open the app as well.
title: Good reader

author: Andrew Lewis
comment: Not really a fan of this app.  It's material, and looks nice.  When it functions properly, it works great.  Most of the time when it loads the newest articles, as soon as you read one article, it loads a whole new group of articles, completely. Good luck reading a article you saw ahead of the present one you're reading.  Other times, it loads articles with the wrong source, or loads six or seven articles all in a row, repeatedly. Wrote the developer with no response as of yet.

author: Matthew Arnold
comment: Some feeds don't ever work even though they do in flym. And opml import never works for me but the same opml file works in flym.
title: Error processing OPML

author: Brent L
comment: It has big problems with marking  articles as read. Sometimes it will mark all articles as read without scrolling at all. When it doesn't do that, it's basic mark as read on scroll logic is pretty bad, it will mark any article as read as soon as a sliver of  the article card/list appears on the screen, so in order to make sure you don't accidentally mark an article as read, you have to make sure you don't let the bottom most article fully scroll onto the screen. Annoying for a feed reader
title: Automatically marks all articles as read

author: Lance Smith
comment: Thank. You. For this app. I looked everywhere, and this is the only app that lets you read ENTIRE articles on your watch!! Thank you!
title: Perfect for watch.

author: Noah Smith
comment: Simple. Useful.

author: Alexander Grenon
comment: I bought this app so that the endless search for a multi source news app could come to an end. This app has promise, but seeing as my news feed is separately organized from one device to another, it seems very half baked and unfinished. What I would love to see is an account system that links to the device's Google account that shares the sources for the articles. Otherwise, this app is a good start but lacks stability to be my daily driver for news.
title: Beautifully disorganized

author: Mohammad Almisbaa
comment: It's just that the websites wrong and empty icons are bugging me.. Keep up the good work!
title: I really really like it.. But it needs a lot of work

author: PJ Anderson
comment: Wonky at first but becomes quickly intuitive, seems to have syncing issues, and there is zero control for the wear app i could find. I hope to see new features and fixes in updates

author: Doug Renze
comment: One of the better newsreader apps out there right now, but still definitely in development.  I use Feedly as my feed aggregator and connect Source to it.  Source doesn't currently sync the read status of articles FROM Feedly after they've been downloaded; i.e., if I read an article on the desktop, then resync, it's still marked as unread on my device.  Also, there is no unread article count.  Add these features and the app would be a high 4.  If it also showed the individual feed names under my Feedly categories so that I could select a single feed to read, it would be a solid 5.

author: Wayne Mason
comment: App crashes when trying to open it when not connected to any data or wifi. Yes it does fetch lots of full articles but I can't see progress so how do I know it's finished before data is unavailable. I can't see how many feeds I have to read. And it always makes the first feed as read when it downloads. Feeds marked as read don't change how they look until you change menu item. Update:  And marks all as unread if manual is selected.
title: Wish I hadn't tried this app again. Second purchase and so no refund :(

author: Jeff Zimmerman
comment: Great way to check ur Twitter Lists
title: Awesome

author: Aaron Papin
comment: Aside from the issue with all Feedly articles bring marked as read, articles will occasionally have the right headline but the author, source and favicon from the wrong article. Could also benefit from a floating back to the top button.
title: Some issues here and there

author: Max Lakritz
comment: It crashes on launch since the latest update. (Found a fix --- clear data then reboot.)
title: Love it but broken (never mind clear data)

author: Matt
comment: The app has a smooth design with very intuitive features like inline article expansion.  It has beautiful material design and a good selection of sources.  It is smooth and has Android wear support as well.
title: Beautiful material app with brilliant design

author: Zach Lau
comment: Thanks for making an all encompassing app for news! Unfortunately there is a glitch that marks all as read for feedly after reading just one article. In some cases, turning off the screen while reading an article will mark the whole column as read.
title: Great with a couple hiccups.

author: Joe Kelly
comment: Love the app, took a bit getting used to but smooth and looks great!! However in the pictures it shows both system and navigation bars in color but can't seem to find this function in the app? Any ideas? Keep up the great work!
title: Great app!!

author: Ash Smith
comment: After having the app for less than 5 minutes, it decided to mark all of my Inoreader feeds as read, except for the podcasts.
title: Terrible Start

author: Nishant Moorthy
comment: No readability functionality (that I can find in the settings), embedded images in the articles are not being displayed. Some articles have no text from the article. Needs a bit of work.

author: Brandon Giesel
comment: I originally used this app back when it was still a beta and first launched on the Play Storefor some time, but ended up uninstalling it because it only seemed to show my twitter feed. I just recently rediscovered this app and I love it. The beautiful layout, transitions, and enjoyable experience make using this app an outter joy. This app helps you bring together many different sources to create the ultimate personally curated news feed available on Android.
title: Ultimate Android News Aggregate App

author: William Steele
comment: The app marked 11 feeds as read 8n a matter of seconds HUNDREDS of articles marked as read with no warning, just because they were added as sources in the app.
title: Feedly users beware!

author: Alex Sorkin
comment: If I could save articles to feedly instead of just the Source app it would be perfect.   Also, half the time it doesn't show the text, and it marks everything as read. I can't use this
title: Beautiful interface but needs better feedly integration

author: Deniss Soare
comment: I use it every day. One of the must have apps on my device. Does perfectly what is intended for. Improves reader's experience with every new update. Responsive developer. :)
title: The Revolution in News

author: גומא רביד
comment: Plus, unread count would be great
title: Need to be able to read  source instead of whole category

author: Mike Kurtzman
comment: I'd like the option to mark all as read to return right now.

reply.author: Luke Klinker
reply.content: Mark as read is and has always been available, open up the drawer and there is a checkmark near the top right corner.
